meanings.definition: Incapable of being computed or calculated.
meanings.sent1: The number of stars in the sky is incomputably large.
meanings.sent2: The complexity of the problem was incomputably high.
meanings.sent3: Trying to count all the grains of sand on the beach would be incomputably tedious.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was incomputably deep, like an ocean with no end.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range stretched incomputably far into the horizon.

meanings.definition: To an extent that cannot be calculated or determined.
meanings.sent1: The value of friendship cannot be incomputably measured.
meanings.sent2: His patience with the children was incomputably admirable.
meanings.sent3: She incomputably underestimated the time it would take to finish the project.
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words was incomputably profound, resonating with everyone.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset painted the sky incomputably.
